medical_history.chief_complaint: Hepatitis C infection, hepatocellular carcinoma, and recurrent bleeding.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 58-year-old man with hemophilia, had a diagnosis of hemophilia A since infancy. Two years prior to admission, liver biopsy revealed chronic hepatitis, and eight months prior, an ultrasound revealed a solid mass in the liver. This mass was subsequently diagnosed as hepatocellular carcinoma via fine-needle aspiration biopsy seven months before admission. The patient also experienced a hemarthrosis in the shoulder two weeks prior to admission after a minor injury.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hemophilia A (factor VIII deficiency), chronic hepatitis C infection, essential hypertension, benign prostatic hypertrophy, urinary tract infections, left hip and left knee replacements due to chronic hemarthroses.
medical_history.family_history: The patient is the first in his extended family with a bleeding disorder. His father had Parkinsonâ€™s disease and prostate cancer; his mother had rheumatoid arthritis and coronary artery disease. One grandson has hemophilia and spina bifida.
medical_history.social_history: The patient works in education and lives with his wife. He is of African-American ancestry.
